comments: With the exception of the initial 2s, these are numbers such that if Pascal's triangle is written in base a(n) - 1, the first n - 2 rows give the digits of the powers of a(n) written in that base. This is most often noticed for the powers of 11 since of course we use decimal. - _Alonso del Arte_, Jul 10 2011
links: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 18 1999
